intro: Ixora wightiana, commonly known as the Indian flame or red flame bush, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Southeast Asia, including India, Malaysia, and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of bright red, tubular flowers that bloom throughout the year. Ixora wightiana thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and full sun exposure. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant floral display and adaptability to various garden settings.
